name: Citrine Sleet TTPs
description: TTPs used by North Korean threat actor, Citrine Sleet exploiting Chromium zero-day (CVE-2024-7971).

techniques.comment: The North Korean threat actor, Citrine Sleet, exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Chromium (CVE-2024-7971) to gain remote code execution (RCE).
The actor used the FudModule rootkit to perform system reconnaissance activities.
The actor created fake websites masquerading as legitimate cryptocurrency trading platforms.
Potential targets may have been directed to the exploit domain via a spearphishing link.
Citrine Sleet used AppleJeus malware to capture information from infected targets.
Used to load the FudModule rootkit into memory and start execution.
A sandboxed escape exploit was used to gain higher privileges.
The actor deployed FudModule, a sophisticated rootkit malware that specifically targets kernel access while evading detection.
Citrine Sleet exploited a number of known vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-7971 and CVE-2024-38106) in order to gain initial access, evade detection and escalate privileges.
Citrine Sleet has conducted extensive reconnaissance of the cryptocurrency industry and individuals associated with it, using social engineering tactics.
